intro: Rechsteineria flavescens, commonly known as the yellow rechsteineria, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or well-drained soils, often in high-altitude environments. Its leaves are broad and strap-like, and it produces small, clustered inflorescences. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
